results.title: Bigger than Texas
results.creator_credit: Mark Pugh, Hugh Burton and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: During a bank hold-up the robber and one of his victims strike up an unlikely rapport. An ‘almost’ love story about the chance meeting of two misfits in search of escape routes from their sordid lives. The music and Pugh’s photography propel these intriguing characters through a world of surreal suspense.

results.title: Big town (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Claudia Weill, Eliot Noyes, Michael Bortman and Cyclops Films
results.brief_description: Presents five vignettes about life in and around New York City. “Mannequin” - by Michael Bortman - preparation for a mannequin parade. “Marriage” - a city marriage; “Commuters” - early morning commuters; “Yoga” - a yoga group; “Lost and Found” - the little losses that loom large to the people of the big city - by Elliot Noyes, Jr and Claudia Weill.

results.title: Big people, little people
results.brief_description: A big city is inhabited only by Little People (children) who do all the things Big People usually do - as policemen, train drivers, postmen, builders, housewives - but this leaves the play-grounds empty. However, the mayor is wise and sends for some Big People to take over the work of the city.

results.title: Big nose: Takeshi Hoshino with the Tasmanian Puppet Theatre
results.brief_description: This film explores the concept of puppetry as an art form as it goes backstage at the Tasmanian Puppet Theatre. Takeshi Hoshino, art director from Japan’s Puk Theatre designs and directs the production of “Big Nose”, a traditional Japanese story. Suitable for years prep-6 and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Big night out
results.brief_description: Wilbur Wilde and Kerry Simpson feature in this rap cartoon addressing the importance of not sharing needles and how to correctly clean them. Using animated and studio footage the story revolves around a party where the issue of safe needle use arises. “Big Night Out” provides safe use messages (ie: cleaning injecting equipment effectively and where to get new needles and syringes) via the Streetwise cartoon character, Dr Klevadik. The language utilised within the video is “street based” in order to increase target group acceptance. Aims to provide safe messages regarding intravenous drug use and potential HIV and HepB transmission.

results.title: Big Henry and the polka dot kid
results.creator_credit: Richard Marquand, Linda Gottlieb and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Presents an adaptation of the novel ‘Luke Baldwin’s Vow’ by Morley Callaghan, about a ten year old orphan boy who goes to live with his aunt and uncle in rural Canada. Shows how the boy’s love for an old blind dog leads to conflict with his uncle who feels that the animal is impractical to keep.

results.title: Big H
results.creator_credit: David Perry, Australia Council and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: An example to educators of what can be done to arouse and maintain children’s interest in the arts. Howard Spicer is known to thousands of school children all over Australia as “Big H” - the Operatic Bikie. Dressed in leather, he rides his motorbike into classrooms and introduces young people to opera. Using Spicer’s work as an example the film illustrates the concept of innovative arts. Suitable for secondary years 7-12, teachers and tertiary level.
